21-0210.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes for the Federal Legislation Committee meeting held Monday, August 31, 2020.A motion was made by Vice Chair Supernaw, seconded by Member Saro, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Saro, Supernaw and Richardson2.

21-0211.summary: Recommendation to receive and file staff recommendations for the City’s 2021 Federal Legislative agenda, and forward the Federal Legislation Committee’s recommendations to the City Council for adoption.Tyler Curley, Manager of Government Affairs, spoke; and presented the staff report.Chair Richardson spoke.Vice Chair Supernaw spoke.Councilwoman Saro spoke.A motion was made by Vice Chair Supernaw, seconded by Member Saro, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Saro, Supernaw and Richardson3.

21-0212.summary: Recommendation to review and consider a resolution in support of H.R. 1384, following City Council’s motion on December 8, 2020 to refer support for H.R. 1384 to the Federal Legislation Committee, and forward the recommendation to the City Council for adoption.Tyler Curley, Manager of Government Affairs, spoke; and presented the staff report.Chair Richardson spoke.Page 2 of 5TELECONFERENCE, 3:00 PMTHURSDAY, MARCH 11, 2021CITY OF LONG BEACHFEDERAL LEGISLATION COMMITTEE MINUTESA motion was made by Chair Richardson, seconded by Vice Chair Supernaw, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Saro, Supernaw and Richardson4.

21-0213.summary: Recommendation to review and consider support for legislative proposals; the American Rescue Plan Act, the Equality Act, the U.S. Citizenship Act, and the For the People Act and forward the recommendation to the City Council for adoption.Tyler Curley, Manager of Government Affairs, spoke; and presented the staff report.Chair Richardson spoke.Councilwoman Saro spoke.Vice Chair Supernaw spoke.A motion was made by Vice Chair Supernaw, seconded by Member Saro, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Saro, Supernaw and Richardson5.

21-0214.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a presentation on the Long Beach Recovery Act proposal.Chair Richardson spoke.Mayor Garcia spoke.A dialogue ensued between Mayor Garcia and Chair Richardson.Thomas Modica, City Manager, spoke; and provided a PowerPoint presentation.Chair Richardson spoke.Vice Chair Supernaw spoke.Page 3 of 5TELECONFERENCE, 3:00 PMTHURSDAY, MARCH 11, 2021CITY OF LONG BEACHFEDERAL LEGISLATION COMMITTEE MINUTESThomas Modica, City Manager, spoke.Councilwoman Saro spoke.Abraham Zavala spoke.Aleece Hanson spoke.Billa Bar-Zion spoke.Calvin Brumbaugh spoke.Chelsea Velez spoke.Heather spoke.James Suazo spoke.Harriette Ellis spoke.Jamilet Ochoa spoke.Katia Vergara spoke.Maria Lopez spoke.Mercy Solorzano spoke.Steven Estrada spoke.Susanne Browne spoke.James Marks spoke.Victor Sanchez spoke.Timothy James spoke.Betty Ruiz spoke.Elizabeth Gonzalez spoke.Page 4 of 5TELECONFERENCE, 3:00 PMTHURSDAY, MARCH 11, 2021CITY OF LONG BEACHFEDERAL LEGISLATION COMMITTEE MINUTESJose Quezada spoke.Chair Richardson spoke.A motion was made by Chair Richardson, seconded by Member Saro, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Saro, Supernaw and Richardson6.
